attributes.description: During my research of a wooden graphite pencil I found that it was much more complex then "lead" in a wooden tube with rubber on top. While I was going in depth about this product I found that even a simple & common item like a pencil could possibly draw resources from every corner of the globe. This whole project showed me that a supply chain can change drastically based on the function the product is expected to do, and the commonness of an item (The pencil for example) will give most people a false perception of the complexity of the supply chain for that object. By Devon
attributes.title: Its just a pencil.

attributes.description: Pumice is harvested from volcanic islands as well as floating deposits.
attributes.title: Pumice deposits
Pencil Factory
attributes.description: Here is were all of the components come together in order to create this tool that everyone uses. First graphite, clay, and water are mixed in order to create a paste that will be cooked into a solid rod. Meanwhile the cedar log would be cut into blocks that would be 7.25" x 0.25" x 2.75", these will be cut again into cylinders that are split to have led placed inside. Then the graphite rod will be placed between the sides of one of these cylinders then glued together, painted, varnished then have an eraser clamped to the top with a tin ring. By this point the pencil is packed and shipped out for sale.

attributes.title: Cedar tree farm
attributes.description: Cedar trees are used for pencils due to the lack of warping in the wood as well as the strength of the wood.

attributes.title: graphite mine/factory
attributes.description: Here graphite is either mined from natural deposits or separated from silicone in a mechanical process.

attributes.title: Latex tree farm
attributes.description: Latex is harvested here in order to be manufactured into rubber for various uses.

attributes.title: Rubber manufacturing plant
attributes.description: Here the latex is mixed with pumice in order to form the eraser for a pencil.

attributes.title: Tin Mine
attributes.description: Tin is mined here in Peru.

attributes.title: Smelting plant
attributes.description: The tin ore is smelted here in order to create a usable metal.

attributes.title: Consumer
attributes.description: Here in Denver you can by pencils at almost every department store, and these simple tools are used every day across the state and country.

attributes.title: Clay Query
attributes.description: Clay is taken from this area in order to create the graphite used in pencils.

attributes.title: Varnish mixing plant
attributes.description: Here the various chemical components needed for varnish are gathered and mixed to create this strong coating.

attributes.title: Cedar tree farm to Pencil Factory
Latex tree farm to Rubber manufacturing plant
Rubber manufacturing plant to Pencil Factory
Varnish mixing plant to Pencil Factory
Pumice deposits to Rubber manufacturing plant
